oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. James B. Owen to his wife, Sally
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf., USA, married Sarah (Sally) Bell, daughter of the founder of Bells, Tenn. He wrote her in Memphis from Berys Landing, La. He received pictures from home, was doing well and would send money home. Owen hoped; for a furlough to see her and their "sweet little babe" Dorah soon. "I had rather see you than to see or have any thing on earth." He died Aug. 26, 1863 of yellow fever at Vicksburg, Miss.
